course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Physical Chemistry Laboratory
course.description: This is the laboratory course corresponding to the lecture course CHEM 2410. The topics of experiments covered in the laboratory course will be related to those taught in the lecture course, such as thermodynamics, etc. For CHEM students under the four-year degree only.
course.prerequisites: CHEM 1030 AND (MATH 1014 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1024)

reviews.author: JK1
reviews.comment_content:
-----1-day Lab-----
Experiment 1: Heat Capacity of Metals
Experiment 2: Second Law of Thermodynamics (Mixing and Fusion of water)
Experiment 3: Henry's Law (Henry's Law constant of CO2 in water)
-----2-day Lab-----
Experiment 4: Binary Liquid-vapour Equilibrium Raoult's Law Plot and Liquid-vapour Phase Diagram (acetone and xylene system)
Experiment 5: Thernodynamic Equilibrium: Determination of ΔG, ΔS, ΔH and Keq  for Cobalt Chloride Complexation Reactions (Heating and Cooling)
Experiment 6: Electrochemical Equilibrium: Determination of E° and ΔG in Electrochemical Cell (also standardisation of NaOH and titration of HCl)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Briefing before each experiment
Instruction and help from lab TAs
reviews.comment_grading:
60% Report
(MSDS and e-report)
All grading are based on computer, therefore you need to enter all the data correctly and in the format specified. You need to answer exact character using the word bank given for some non-numerical questions. Otherwise, you will get a low mark for a typo or wrong format.
40% Final Exam
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable, but you need to submit each e-report after 24 hours of the completion of each experiment.
Check twice before each submit, no re-submission or modification.

reviews.author: supermin
reviews.title: Make sure you type in data correctly!
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction

Expt 1 - Equipartition Theorem: Heat Capacity of Metals at Constant Volume

Expt 2 - Second Law of Thermodynamics: Entropy Variation with Temperature

Expt 3 - Henry's Law: Determination of Henry's Law Constant and Molar
Solubility of Carbon Dioxide in Water

Expt 4 - Binary Liquid-Vapour Equilibrium: Raoult's Law Plot and Liquid-
Vapour Phase Diagram of Aromatic and Ketone Systems

Expt 5 - Electrochemical Equilibrium: Measurement of the Standard Electrode
Potential for Silver/Silver Chloride Electrode

Oral Quiz Prep and actual one.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Tung is very kind and will answer questions when asked.
She plays pre-recorded video of lab breifing.

Other professors and TAs also chip in and answer on her behalf at times.

But, the professors' English pronunciations are sometimes difficult to understand. Be weary of that.
reviews.comment_grading:
Refer to workload on how e-reports are done.

Quizzes are easy. Just read through Lab Manual and digest it. All answers are in there.

Oral exam is basically TAs asking ONE question (calculation, concept, definition, etc), and given 3 minutes to answer it on a paper or on ZOOM board thing. Don't have to show working, only the answer is graded. Marked out of 20.

Five e-Reports - 60%
Lab Quiz - 20%
Oral Exam - 20%

I got very good scores for Quizzes
18/20 for Oral Exam
Good scores for Report
A- at the end. Very nice.
reviews.comment_workload:
You need to plug in all data and values in this specific website given by the professor during introductory session.

MAKE SURE THE DATAS HAVE PROPER SIG FIGS AND ARE ACCURATE. The marking is done by a computer program, so any slight offsets in data input will be marked wrong. TAs or profs will not go through them.

Given that we are all given same pre-processed data, as long as you do the calculations properly, you will get perfect scores.

You're gonna spend at least 3 hours per experiment.

reviews.author: gazelle
reviews.title: The best grade ever since my study at HKUST~
reviews.comment_content:
I feel like this lab course is carefully designed, in that the most typical experiments of pchem are covered. Examples include Raoult's Law, Henry's Law, thermodynamic eqm, and electrochemical eqm, etc.

However, due to the limit of time and resources, some other interesting pchem expts are not covered. It would be better if we students could also get a taste on these rather than just understanding the related theories and calculations through boring pchem lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is clear and logical, except that Dr. Tung usually speaks very fast. As long as you understand the lab manuals well, are able to follow her logic during lab briefing sessions, and are good at using Excel, your lab reports will be perfectly fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good imo.

I personally receive an A+ with total score >95%. Thanks Dr. Tung for giving me this special Christmas gift~ XD

If you desire an A range, you should aim at full score for lab quizzes and nearly full score for lab reports. These are the only items that you could control by yourself. Frankly, I don't have ideas how the TAs grade our lab performance. But from my observation, if you don't freeride your labmate and are able to quickly and smoothly finish the labwork, you are likely to score high.
reviews.comment_workload:
As a 1 credit course, the workload is a bit higher than my expectation.

While the workload for preparing lab quizzes is acceptable, it is especially time-consuming for doing lab reports. I have to double or even triple check the figures before I click the submit button to avoid careless mistakes or typos. The system simply doesn't allow resubmission even before deadline!!! (How user-unfriendly it is!!!)

Also, to avoid problems arising from rounding off in calculations, it is essential to take at least 7 d.p. if the question does not otherwise specify.

reviews.author: LukaModric
reviews.comment_content:
1. Equipartition Theorem: Heat Capacity of Metals at Constant Volume
2. Second Law of Thermodynamics: Entropy Variation with Temperature
3. Henry's Law: Determination of Henry's Law Constant and Molar Solubility of Carbon Dioxide in Water
4. Binary Liquid-Vapour Equilibrium: Raoult's Law Plot and LiquidVapour Phase Diagram of Aromatic and Ketone Systems
5. Thermodynamic Equilibrium: Determinations of changes of Enthalpy and Entropy for Cobalt(II) Complexation Reactions Through Gibbs Energy Changes At Constant Pressure
6. Electrochemical Equilibrium: Measurement of the Standard Electrode Potential for Silver/Silver Chloride Electrode

Online Lab: Expt6
reviews.comment_teaching:
The briefing by the instructor is clear.
Some TA forget to have a briefing.
Some questions in the quiz are too detailed.
IAs are nice.
-To be updated-
reviews.comment_grading:
60%  Reports
20%  Lab Quizzes
20%  Lab Performance
Take the best 4 out of 6.
-To be updated-
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much.
No final exam.
Lab reports to be submitted in 24 hours.
Graphs to be submitted in 1 week.
-To be updated-

reviews.comment_content:
Just like normal chem lab
About phychem.
Doing lab is quite easy.
E-reports are troublesome.
reviews.comment_teaching:
TAs are helpful
but I like the ones in syn lab more.
reviews.comment_grading:
Really bad
Be careful to do all of your lab report.
As you can only submit it once, and you cant change your answer after you hand in.
The system is really stupid.
I got almost full marks in final exam
But one of my e-report got extremely low mark, as the system did not allow you to submit your answer again even before the deadline.
And got B+.......The most bad grade for chem lab.
